required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate Efficacy of CellCept (Mycophenolate Mofetil) in Patients With Lupus Nephritis
clinical_study.official_title: A Study to Evaluate the Efficacy of CellCept, Administered in a Sequential Treatment Scheme, in Delaying Progressive Renal Damage in Patients With Lupus Nephritis

oversight_info.authority: Venezuela: Instituto Nacional de Higiene "Rafael Rangel"

brief_summary.textblock: This study will compare the efficacy of CellCept (0.5-2g/day po) and cyclophosphamide (0.5-1g/m2 quarterly) as maintenance treatment for patients with lupus nephritis. All patients will receive induction treatment with cyclophosphamide (0.5-1g/m2 monthly) for 6 months, and will then be randomized to the maintenance phase of the study for a further 6 months, followed by 6 months of treatment-free follow-up. The anticipated time on study treatment is 12 months.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

arm_group.description: Induction Phase (Months 1 through 6): Cyclophosphamide, 0.5 - 1 grams per square meter (g/m2) intravenous (i.v.) pulse once per month. Concurrent prednisone, 1 milligram per kilogram per day (mg/kg/day) gradually reduced to 10 mg/day orally (p.o.). Maintenance Phase (Months 7 through 12): mycophenolate mofetil (MMF), 1 g/day, p.o. twice daily (b.i.d.) for 2 weeks; 1.5 g/day p.o. three times daily (t.i.d.) for the next 2 weeks; 2 g/day p.o. b.i.d. for the remainder of the Maintenance Phase. Concurrent prednisone, as in the Induction Phase.

Induction Phase (Months 1 through 6): Cyclophosphamide, 0.5 - 1 g/m2 i.v. pulse once per month. Concurrent prednisone, 1 mg/kg/day p.o. gradually reduced to 10 mg/day p.o. Maintenance Phase (Months 7 through 12): Cyclophosphamide, 0.5-1 g/m2 i.v. pulse every 3 months. Concurrent prednisone, as in the Induction Phase.

intervention.description: 1 g/day, p.o. b.i.d. for 2 weeks; 1.5 g/day p.o. t.i.d. for the next 2 weeks; and 2 g/day p.o. b.i.d. for the remainder of the Maintenance Phase.
0.5 - 1 g/m2 i.v. pulse once per month
1 mg/kg p.o. once per day; reduced by 5 mg every 2 weeks up to 20 mg/day; followed by a reduction of 2.5 mg every 2 weeks until reaching the maintenance phase of 10 mg/day.
